Hebrew: דְּבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָיָ֔ה אֶל־יוֹאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּתוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: The word of G<small>OD</small> that came to Joel son of Pethuel.
Transliteration: devar-yehovah asher hayah el-yvoel ven-fetuel

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹאת֙ הַזְּקֵנִ֔ים וְהַֽאֲזִ֔ינוּ כֹּ֖ל יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ הֶהָ֤יְתָה זֹּאת֙ בִּֽימֵיכֶ֔ם וְאִ֖ם בִּימֵ֥י אֲבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Listen to this, O elders,
Give ear, all inhabitants of the land.
Has the like of this happened in your days
Or in the days of your ancestors?
Transliteration: shimeu-zot hazekeniym vehaaziynu khol yvoshevey haarets hehayetah zot viymeykhem veim viymey avoteykhem

Hebrew: עָלֶ֖יהָ לִבְנֵיכֶ֣ם סַפֵּ֑רוּ וּבְנֵיכֶם֙ לִבְנֵיהֶ֔ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם לְד֥וֹר אַחֵֽר׃
Translated:
Tell your children about it,
And let your children tell theirs,
And their children the next generation!
Transliteration: aleyha liveneykhem saferu uveneykhem liveneyhem uveneyhem ledvor acher

Hebrew: יֶ֤תֶר הַגָּזָם֙ אָכַ֣ל הָאַרְבֶּ֔ה וְיֶ֥תֶר הָאַרְבֶּ֖ה אָכַ֣ל הַיָּ֑לֶק וְיֶ֣תֶר הַיֶּ֔לֶק אָכַ֖ל הֶחָסִֽיל׃
Translated:
What the cutter has left, the locust has devoured;
What the locust has left, the grub has devoured;
And what the grub has left, the hopper has devoured.
Transliteration: yeter hagazam akhal haareveh veyeter haareveh akhal hayalek veyeter hayelek akhal hechasiyl

Hebrew: הָקִ֤יצוּ שִׁכּוֹרִים֙ וּבְכ֔וּ וְהֵילִ֖לוּ כׇּל־שֹׁ֣תֵי יָ֑יִן עַל־עָסִ֕יס כִּ֥י נִכְרַ֖ת מִפִּיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Wake up, you drunkards, and weep,
Wail, all you swillers of wine—
For the new wine that is denied you!
Transliteration: hakiytsu shikhvoriym uvekhu veheylilu khׇl-shotey yayiin al-asiys khiy nikherat mifiykhem

Hebrew: כִּי־גוֹי֙ עָלָ֣ה עַל־אַרְצִ֔י עָצ֖וּם וְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֑ר שִׁנָּיו֙ שִׁנֵּ֣י אַרְיֵ֔ה וּֽמְתַלְּע֥וֹת לָבִ֖יא לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For a nation has invaded my land,
Vast beyond counting,
With teeth like the teeth of a lion,
With the fangs of a lion’s breed.
Transliteration: khiy-gvoy alah al-aretsiy atsum veeyn misefar shinayv shiney areeih umetalevot laviy lvo

Hebrew: שָׂ֤ם גַּפְנִי֙ לְשַׁמָּ֔ה וּתְאֵנָתִ֖י לִקְצָפָ֑ה חָשֹׂ֤ף חֲשָׂפָהּ֙ וְהִשְׁלִ֔יךְ הִלְבִּ֖ינוּ שָׂרִיגֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
They have laid my vines waste
And splintered my fig trees:
They have stripped off their bark and thrown [it] away;
Their runners have turned white.
Transliteration: sham gafeniy leshamah uteenatiy liketsafah chashof chashafah vehisheliykhe hileviynu shariygeyha

Hebrew: אֱלִ֕י כִּבְתוּלָ֥ה חֲגֻרַת־שַׂ֖ק עַל־בַּ֥עַל נְעוּרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
Lament—like a maiden girt with sackcloth
For the husband of her youth!
Transliteration: eliy khivetulah chagurat-shak al-vaal neureyha

Hebrew: הׇכְרַ֥ת מִנְחָ֛ה וָנֶ֖סֶךְ מִבֵּ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה אָֽבְלוּ֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים מְשָׁרְתֵ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Offering and libation have ceased
From the House of GOD;
The priests must mourn
Who minister to GOD.
Transliteration: hׇkherat minechah vanesekhe miveyt yehovah avelu hakhohaniym mesharetey yehovah

Hebrew: שֻׁדַּ֣ד שָׂדֶ֔ה אָבְלָ֖ה אֲדָמָ֑ה כִּ֚י שֻׁדַּ֣ד דָּגָ֔ן הוֹבִ֥ישׁ תִּיר֖וֹשׁ אֻמְלַ֥ל יִצְהָֽר׃
Translated:
The country is ravaged,
The ground must mourn;
For the new grain is ravaged,
The new wine is dried up,
The new oil has failed.
Transliteration: shudad shadeh avelah adamah khiy shudad dagan hvoviysh tiyrvosh umelal yitsehar

Hebrew: הֹבִ֣ישׁוּ אִכָּרִ֗ים הֵילִ֙ילוּ֙ כֹּֽרְמִ֔ים עַל־חִטָּ֖ה וְעַל־שְׂעֹרָ֑ה כִּ֥י אָבַ֖ד קְצִ֥יר שָׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
Farmers are dismayed
And vine dressers wail
Over wheat and barley;
For the crops of the field are lost.
Transliteration: hoviyshu ikhariym heyliylu khoremiym al-chitah veal-sheorah khiy avad ketsiyr shadeh

Hebrew: הַגֶּ֣פֶן הוֹבִ֔ישָׁה וְהַתְּאֵנָ֖ה אֻמְלָ֑לָה רִמּ֞וֹן גַּם־תָּמָ֣ר וְתַפּ֗וּחַ כׇּל־עֲצֵ֤י הַשָּׂדֶה֙ יָבֵ֔שׁוּ כִּי־הֹבִ֥ישׁ שָׂשׂ֖וֹן מִן־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated:
The vine has dried up,
The fig tree withers,
Pomegranate, palm, and apple—
All the trees of the field are sear.
And joy has dried up
Among the people.
Transliteration: hagefen hvoviyshah vehateenah umelalah rimvon gam-tamar vetafucha khׇl-atsey hashadeh yaveshu khiy-hoviysh shashvon min-veney adam {s}

Hebrew: חִגְר֨וּ וְסִפְד֜וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים הֵילִ֙ילוּ֙ מְשָׁרְתֵ֣י מִזְבֵּ֔חַ בֹּ֚אוּ לִ֣ינוּ בַשַּׂקִּ֔ים מְשָׁרְתֵ֖י אֱלֹהָ֑י כִּ֥י נִמְנַ֛ע מִבֵּ֥ית אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם מִנְחָ֥ה וָנָֽסֶךְ׃
Translated:
Gird yourselves and lament, O priests,
Wail, O ministers of the altar;
Come, spend the night in sackcloth,
O ministers of my God.
For offering and libation are withheld
From the House of your God.
Transliteration: chigeru vesifedu hakhohaniym heyliylu mesharetey mizevecha vou liynu vashakiym mesharetey elohay khiy nimena miveyt eloheykhem minechah vanasekhe

Hebrew: קַדְּשׁוּ־צוֹם֙ קִרְא֣וּ עֲצָרָ֔ה אִסְפ֣וּ זְקֵנִ֗ים כֹּ֚ל יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם וְזַעֲק֖וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Solemnize a fast,
Proclaim an assembly;
Gather the elders—all the inhabitants of the land—
In the House of the ETERNAL your God,
And cry out to GOD.
Transliteration: kadeshu-tsvom kireu atsarah isefu zekeniym khol yoshevey haarets veyt yehovah eloheykhem vezaaku el-yehovah

Hebrew: אֲהָ֖הּ לַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֤י קָרוֹב֙ י֣וֹם יְהֹוָ֔ה וּכְשֹׁ֖ד מִשַּׁדַּ֥י יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
Alas for the day!
For the day of GOD is near;
It shall come like havoc from Shaddai.
Transliteration: ahah layyvom khiy karvov yvom yehovah ukheshod mishaday yavvo

Hebrew: הֲל֛וֹא נֶ֥גֶד עֵינֵ֖ינוּ אֹ֣כֶל נִכְרָ֑ת מִבֵּ֥ית אֱלֹהֵ֖ינוּ שִׂמְחָ֥ה וָגִֽיל׃
Translated:
For food is cut off
Before our very eyes,
And joy and gladness
From the House of our God.
Transliteration: halvo neged eyneynu okhel nikherat miveyt eloheynu shimechah vagiyl

Hebrew: עָבְשׁ֣וּ פְרֻד֗וֹת תַּ֚חַת מֶגְרְפֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם נָשַׁ֙מּוּ֙ אֹֽצָר֔וֹת נֶהֶרְס֖וּ מַמְּגֻר֑וֹת כִּ֥י הֹבִ֖ישׁ דָּגָֽן׃
Translated:
The seeds have shriveled
Under their clods.
The granaries are desolate,
Barns are in ruins,
For the new grain has failed.
Transliteration: aveshu ferudvot tachat megerefoteyhem nashamu otsarvot neheresu mamegurvot khiy hoviysh dagan

Hebrew: מַה־נֶּאֶנְחָ֣ה בְהֵמָ֗ה נָבֹ֙כוּ֙ עֶדְרֵ֣י בָקָ֔ר כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין מִרְעֶ֖ה לָהֶ֑ם גַּם־עֶדְרֵ֥י הַצֹּ֖אן נֶאְשָֽׁמוּ׃
Translated:
How the animals groan!
The herds of cattle are bewildered
Because they have no pasture,
And the flocks of sheep are dazed.
Transliteration: mah-neenechah vehemah navokhu ederey vakar khiy eyn mireeh lahem gam-ederey hatson neeshamu

Hebrew: אֵלֶ֥יךָ יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶקְרָ֑א כִּ֣י אֵ֗שׁ אָֽכְלָה֙ נְא֣וֹת מִדְבָּ֔ר וְלֶ֣הָבָ֔ה לִהֲטָ֖ה כׇּל־עֲצֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated:
To You, O ETERNAL One, I call.
For fire has consumed
The pastures in the wilderness,
And flame has devoured
All the trees of the countryside.
Transliteration: eleykha yehovah ekera khiy esh akhelah nevot midevar velehavah lihatah khׇl-atsey hashadeh

Hebrew: גַּם־בַּהֲמ֥וֹת שָׂדֶ֖ה תַּעֲר֣וֹג אֵלֶ֑יךָ כִּ֤י יָֽבְשׁוּ֙ אֲפִ֣יקֵי מָ֔יִם וְאֵ֕שׁ אָכְלָ֖ה נְא֥וֹת הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃ {ס}
Translated:
The very beasts of the field
Cry out to You;
For the watercourses are dried up,
And fire has consumed
The pastures in the wilderness.
Transliteration: gam-vahamvot shadeh taarvog eleykha khiy yaveshu afiykey mayiim veesh akhelah nevot hamidevar {s}

Hebrew: תִּקְע֨וּ שׁוֹפָ֜ר בְּצִיּ֗וֹן וְהָרִ֙יעוּ֙ בְּהַ֣ר קׇדְשִׁ֔י יִרְגְּז֕וּ כֹּ֖ל יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּי־בָ֥א יוֹם־יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּ֥י קָרֽוֹב׃
Translated:
Blow a horn in Zion,
Sound an alarm on My holy mount!
Let all dwellers on earth tremble,
For the day of GOD has come!
It is close—
Transliteration: tikeu shvofar vetsiyyvon vehariyu vehar kׇdeshiy yiregezu khol yoshevey haarets khiy-va yvom-yehovah khiy karvov

Hebrew: י֧וֹם חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וַאֲפֵלָ֗ה י֤וֹם עָנָן֙ וַעֲרָפֶ֔ל כְּשַׁ֖חַר פָּרֻ֣שׂ עַל־הֶהָרִ֑ים עַ֚ם רַ֣ב וְעָצ֔וּם כָּמֹ֗הוּ לֹ֤א נִֽהְיָה֙ מִן־הָ֣עוֹלָ֔ם וְאַֽחֲרָיו֙ לֹ֣א יוֹסֵ֔ף עַד־שְׁנֵ֖י דּ֥וֹר וָדֽוֹר׃
Translated:
A day of darkness and gloom,
A day of densest cloud
Spread like soot over the hills.
A vast, enormous horde—
Nothing like it has ever happened,
And it shall never happen again
Through the years and ages.
Transliteration: yvom choshekhe vaafelah yvom anan vaarafel kheshachar farush al-hehariym am rav veatsum khamohu lo niheyah min-havolam veacharayv lo yvosef ad-sheney dvor vadvor

Hebrew: לְפָנָיו֙ אָ֣כְלָה אֵ֔שׁ וְאַחֲרָ֖יו תְּלַהֵ֣ט לֶהָבָ֑ה כְּגַן־עֵ֨דֶן הָאָ֜רֶץ לְפָנָ֗יו וְאַֽחֲרָיו֙ מִדְבַּ֣ר שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְגַם־פְּלֵיטָ֖ה לֹא־הָ֥יְתָה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Their vanguard is a consuming fire,
Their rear guard a devouring flame.
Before them the land was like the Garden of Eden,
Behind them, a desolate waste:
Nothing has escaped them.
Transliteration: lefanayv akhelah esh veacharayv telahet lehavah khegan-eden haarets lefanayv veacharayv midevar shemamah vegam-feleytah lo-hayetah lvo

Hebrew: כְּמַרְאֵ֥ה סוּסִ֖ים מַרְאֵ֑הוּ וּכְפָרָשִׁ֖ים כֵּ֥ן יְרוּצֽוּן׃
Translated:
They have the appearance of horses,
They gallop just like steeds.
Transliteration: khemareeh susiym mareehu ukhefarashiym khen yerutsun

Hebrew: כְּק֣וֹל מַרְכָּב֗וֹת עַל־רָאשֵׁ֤י הֶהָרִים֙ יְרַקֵּד֔וּן כְּקוֹל֙ לַ֣הַב אֵ֔שׁ אֹכְלָ֖ה קָ֑שׁ כְּעַ֣ם עָצ֔וּם עֱר֖וּךְ מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated:
With a clatter as of chariots
They bound on the hilltops,
With a noise like a blazing fire
Consuming straw;
Like an enormous horde
Arrayed for battle.
Transliteration: khekvol marekhavvot al-rashey hehariym yerakedun khekvol lahav esh okhelah kash kheam atsum erukhe milechamah

Hebrew: מִפָּנָ֖יו יָחִ֣ילוּ עַמִּ֑ים כׇּל־פָּנִ֖ים קִבְּצ֥וּ פָארֽוּר׃
Translated:
Peoples tremble before them,
All faces turn ashen.
Transliteration: mifanayv yachiylu amiym khׇl-faniym kivetsu farur

Hebrew: כְּגִבּוֹרִ֣ים יְרֻצ֔וּן כְּאַנְשֵׁ֥י מִלְחָמָ֖ה יַעֲל֣וּ חוֹמָ֑ה וְאִ֤ישׁ בִּדְרָכָיו֙ יֵֽלֵכ֔וּן וְלֹ֥א יְעַבְּט֖וּן אֹרְחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated:
They rush like warriors,
They scale a wall like fighters.
And each keeps to his own track.
Their paths never cross;
Transliteration: khegivvoriym yerutsun kheaneshey milechamah yaalu chvomah veiysh viderakhayv eilekhun velo yeavetun orechvotam

Hebrew: וְאִ֤ישׁ אָחִיו֙ לֹ֣א יִדְחָק֔וּן גֶּ֥בֶר בִּמְסִלָּת֖וֹ יֵלֵכ֑וּן וּבְעַ֥ד הַשֶּׁ֛לַח יִפֹּ֖לוּ לֹ֥א יִבְצָֽעוּ׃
Translated:
Not a single one jostles another,
Each keeps to his own course.
And should they fall through a loophole,
They do not get hurt.
Transliteration: veiysh achiyv lo yidechakun gever vimesilatvo eilekhun uvead hashelach yifolu lo yivetsau

Hebrew: בָּעִ֣יר יָשֹׁ֗קּוּ בַּֽחוֹמָה֙ יְרֻצ֔וּן בַּבָּתִּ֖ים יַעֲל֑וּ בְּעַ֧ד הַחַלּוֹנִ֛ים יָבֹ֖אוּ כַּגַּנָּֽב׃
Translated:
They rush up the wall,
They dash about in the city;
They climb into the houses,
They enter like thieves
By way of the windows.
Transliteration: vaiyr yashoku vachvomah yerutsun vavatiym yaalu vead hachalvoniym yavou khaganav

Hebrew: לְפָנָיו֙ רָ֣גְזָה אֶ֔רֶץ רָעֲשׁ֖וּ שָׁמָ֑יִם שֶׁ֤מֶשׁ וְיָרֵ֙חַ֙ קָדָ֔רוּ וְכוֹכָבִ֖ים אָסְפ֥וּ נׇגְהָֽם׃
Translated:
Before them earth trembles,
Heaven shakes,
Sun and moon are darkened,
And stars withdraw their brightness.
Transliteration: lefanayv ragezah erets raashu shamayiim shemesh veyarecha kadaru vekhvokhaviym asefu nׇgeham

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֗ה נָתַ֤ן קוֹלוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י חֵיל֔וֹ כִּ֣י רַ֤ב מְאֹד֙ מַחֲנֵ֔הוּ כִּ֥י עָצ֖וּם עֹשֵׂ֣ה דְבָר֑וֹ כִּֽי־גָד֧וֹל יוֹם־יְהֹוָ֛ה וְנוֹרָ֥א מְאֹ֖ד וּמִ֥י יְכִילֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
And GOD roars aloud
At the head of the divine army;
For vast indeed is this host,
Numberless are those that do God’s bidding.
For great is the day of GOD,
Most terrible—who can endure it?
Transliteration: vayhovah natan kvolvo lifeney cheylvo khiy rav meod machanehu khiy atsum osheh devarvo khiy-gadvol yvom-yehovah venvora meod umiy yekhiylenu

Hebrew: וְגַם־עַתָּה֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה שֻׁ֥בוּ עָדַ֖י בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֑ם וּבְצ֥וֹם וּבִבְכִ֖י וּבְמִסְפֵּֽד׃
Translated:
“Yet even now”—says GOD—
“Turn back to Me with all your hearts,
And with fasting, weeping, and lamenting.”
Transliteration: vegam-atah neum-yehovah shuvu aday vekhׇl-levavekhem uvetsvom uvivekhiy uvemisefed

Hebrew: וְקִרְע֤וּ לְבַבְכֶם֙ וְאַל־בִּגְדֵיכֶ֔ם וְשׁ֖וּבוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־חַנּ֤וּן וְרַחוּם֙ ה֔וּא אֶ֤רֶךְ אַפַּ֙יִם֙ וְרַב־חֶ֔סֶד וְנִחָ֖ם עַל־הָרָעָֽה׃
Translated:
Rend your hearts
Rather than your garments,
And turn back to the ETERNAL your God.
For [God] is gracious and compassionate,
Slow to anger, abounding in kindness,
And renouncing punishment.
Transliteration: vekireu levavekhem veal-vigedeykhem veshuvu el-yehovah eloheykhem khiy-chanun verachum hu erekhe afayiim verav-chesed venicham al-haraah

Hebrew: מִ֥י יוֹדֵ֖עַ יָשׁ֣וּב וְנִחָ֑ם וְהִשְׁאִ֤יר אַחֲרָיו֙ בְּרָכָ֔ה מִנְחָ֣ה וָנֶ֔סֶךְ לַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who knows but [God] may turn and relent,
And leave a blessing behind
For grain offering and drink offering
To the ETERNAL your God?
Transliteration: miy yvodea yashuv venicham vehisheiyr acharayv verakhah minechah vanesekhe layhovah eloheykhem {f}

Hebrew: תִּקְע֥וּ שׁוֹפָ֖ר בְּצִיּ֑וֹן קַדְּשׁוּ־צ֖וֹם קִרְא֥וּ עֲצָרָֽה׃
Translated:
Blow a horn in Zion,
Solemnize a fast,
Proclaim an assembly!
Transliteration: tikeu shvofar vetsiyyvon kadeshu-tsvom kireu atsarah

Hebrew: אִסְפוּ־עָ֞ם קַדְּשׁ֤וּ קָהָל֙ קִבְצ֣וּ זְקֵנִ֔ים אִסְפוּ֙ עֽוֹלָלִ֔ים וְיֹנְקֵ֖י שָׁדָ֑יִם יֵצֵ֤א חָתָן֙ מֵֽחֶדְר֔וֹ וְכַלָּ֖ה מֵחֻפָּתָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Gather the people,
Bid the congregation purify themselves.
Bring together the old,
Gather the babes
And the sucklings at the breast;
Let the bridegroom come out of his chamber,
The bride from her canopied couch.
Transliteration: isefu-am kadeshu kahal kivetsu zekeniym isefu volaliym veyonekey shadayiim eitse chatan mechedervo vekhalah mechufatah

Hebrew: בֵּ֤ין הָאוּלָם֙ וְלַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ יִבְכּוּ֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים מְשָׁרְתֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽיֹאמְר֞וּ ח֧וּסָה יְהֹוָ֣ה עַל־עַמֶּ֗ךָ וְאַל־תִּתֵּ֨ן נַחֲלָתְךָ֤ לְחֶרְפָּה֙ לִמְשׇׁל־בָּ֣ם גּוֹיִ֔ם לָ֚מָּה יֹאמְר֣וּ בָעַמִּ֔ים אַיֵּ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Between the portico and the altar,
Let the priests, GOD’s ministers, weep
And say:
“Oh, spare Your people, ETERNAL One!
Let not Your possession become a mockery,
To be taunted by nations!
Let not the peoples say,
‘Where is their God?’”
Transliteration: veyn haulam velamizevecha yivekhu hakhohaniym mesharetey yehovah veyomeru chusah yehovah al-amekha veal-titen nachalatekha lecherefah limeshׇl-vam gvoyim lamah yomeru vaamiym ayeh eloheyhem

Hebrew: וַיְקַנֵּ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה לְאַרְצ֑וֹ וַיַּחְמֹ֖ל עַל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Then GOD was roused
In behalf of this land
And had compassion
Upon this people.
Transliteration: vayekane yehovah learetsvo vayachemol al-amvo

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַן יְהֹוָ֜ה וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לְעַמּ֗וֹ הִנְנִ֨י שֹׁלֵ֤חַ לָכֶם֙ אֶת־הַדָּגָן֙ וְהַתִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְהַיִּצְהָ֔ר וּשְׂבַעְתֶּ֖ם אֹת֑וֹ וְלֹא־אֶתֵּ֨ן אֶתְכֶ֥ם ע֛וֹד חֶרְפָּ֖ה בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
In response to this covenanted people
GOD declared:
“I will grant you the new grain,
The new wine, and the new oil,
And you shall have them in abundance.
Nevermore will I let you be
A mockery among the nations.
Transliteration: vayaan yehovah vayomer leamvo hineniy sholecha lakhem et-hadagan vehatiyrvosh vehayitsehar ushevaetem otvo velo-eten etekhem vod cherefah vagvoyim

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־הַצְּפוֹנִ֞י אַרְחִ֣יק מֵעֲלֵיכֶ֗ם וְהִדַּחְתִּיו֮ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ צִיָּ֣ה וּשְׁמָמָה֒ אֶת־פָּנָ֗יו אֶל־הַיָּם֙ הַקַּדְמֹנִ֔י וְסֹפ֖וֹ אֶל־הַיָּ֣ם הָאַחֲר֑וֹן וְעָלָ֣ה בׇאְשׁ֗וֹ וְתַ֙עַל֙ צַחֲנָת֔וֹ כִּ֥י הִגְדִּ֖יל לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated:
I will drive the northerner far from you,
I will thrust it into a parched and desolate land—
Its van to the Eastern Sea
And its rear to the Western Sea;
And the stench of it shall go up,
And the foul smell rise.”
For [GOD] shall work great deeds.
Transliteration: veet-hatsefvoniy arechiyk mealeykhem vehidachetiyv el-erets tsiyah ushemamah et-fanayv el-hayam hakademoniy vesofvo el-hayam haacharvon vealah vׇeshvo vetaal tsachanatvo khiy higediyl laashvot

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽירְאִ֖י אֲדָמָ֑ה גִּ֣ילִי וּשְׂמָ֔חִי כִּֽי־הִגְדִּ֥יל יְהֹוָ֖ה לַעֲשֽׂוֹת׃
Translated:
Fear not, O soil, rejoice and be glad;
For GOD has wrought great deeds.
Transliteration: al-tiyreiy adamah giyliy ushemachiy khiy-higediyl yehovah laashvot

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽירְאוּ֙ בַּהֲמ֣וֹת שָׂדַ֔י כִּ֥י דָשְׁא֖וּ נְא֣וֹת מִדְבָּ֑ר כִּי־עֵץ֙ נָשָׂ֣א פִרְי֔וֹ תְּאֵנָ֥ה וָגֶ֖פֶן נָתְנ֥וּ חֵילָֽם׃
Translated:
Fear not, O beasts of the field,
For the pastures in the wilderness
Are clothed with grass.
The trees have borne their fruit;
Fig tree and vine
Have yielded their strength.
Transliteration: al-tiyreu vahamvot shaday khiy dasheu nevot midevar khiy-ets nasha fireyvo teenah vagefen natenu cheylam

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י צִיּ֗וֹן גִּ֤ילוּ וְשִׂמְחוּ֙ בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־נָתַ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם אֶת־הַמּוֹרֶ֖ה לִצְדָקָ֑ה וַיּ֣וֹרֶד לָכֶ֗ם גֶּ֛שֶׁם מוֹרֶ֥ה וּמַלְק֖וֹשׁ בָּרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated:
O children of Zion, be glad,
Rejoice in the ETERNAL your God.
For you have been given the early rain out of kindness,
Now the rain is made to fall [as] formerly—
The early rain and the late—
Transliteration: uveney tsiyyvon giylu veshimechu vayhovah eloheykhem khiy-natan lakhem et-hamvoreh litsedakah vayyvored lakhem geshem mvoreh umalekvosh varishvon

Hebrew: וּמָלְא֥וּ הַגֳּרָנ֖וֹת בָּ֑ר וְהֵשִׁ֥יקוּ הַיְקָבִ֖ים תִּיר֥וֹשׁ וְיִצְהָֽר׃
Translated:
And threshing floors shall be piled with grain,
And vats shall overflow with new wine and oil.
Transliteration: umaleu hagoranvot var veheshiyku hayekaviym tiyrvosh veyitsehar

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּמְתִּ֤י לָכֶם֙ אֶת־הַשָּׁנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר֙ אָכַ֣ל הָאַרְבֶּ֔ה הַיֶּ֖לֶק וְהֶחָסִ֣יל וְהַגָּזָ֑ם חֵילִי֙ הַגָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר שִׁלַּ֖חְתִּי בָּכֶֽם׃
Translated:
“I will repay you for the years
Consumed by swarms and hoppers,
By grubs and locusts,
The great army I let loose against you.
Transliteration: veshilametiy lakhem et-hashaniym asher akhal haareveh hayelek vehechasiyl vehagazam cheyliy hagadvol asher shilachetiy vakhem

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אָכוֹל֙ וְשָׂב֔וֹעַ וְהִלַּלְתֶּ֗ם אֶת־שֵׁ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה עִמָּכֶ֖ם לְהַפְלִ֑יא וְלֹא־יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ עַמִּ֖י לְעוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
And you shall eat your fill
And praise the name of the ETERNAL your God
Who dealt so wondrously with you—
My people shall be shamed no more.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem akhvol veshavvoa vehilaletem et-shem yehovah eloheykhem asher-ashah imakhem lehafeliy velo-eivoshu amiy levolam

Hebrew: וִידַעְתֶּ֗ם כִּ֣י בְקֶ֤רֶב יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אָ֔נִי וַאֲנִ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם וְאֵ֣ין ע֑וֹד וְלֹא־יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ עַמִּ֖י לְעוֹלָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
And you shall know
That I am in the midst of Israel:
That I the ETERNAL One am your God
And there is no other.
And My people shall be shamed no more.”
Transliteration: viydaetem khiy vekerev yisherael aniy vaaniy yehovah eloheykhem veeyn vod velo-eivoshu amiy levolam {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה אַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן אֶשְׁפּ֤וֹךְ אֶת־רוּחִי֙ עַל־כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֔ר וְנִבְּא֖וּ בְּנֵיכֶ֣ם וּבְנוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם זִקְנֵיכֶם֙ חֲלֹמ֣וֹת יַחֲלֹמ֔וּן בַּח֣וּרֵיכֶ֔ם חֶזְיֹנ֖וֹת יִרְאֽוּ׃
Translated:
After that,
I will pour out My spirit on all flesh;
Your sons and daughters shall prophesy;
Your elders shall dream dreams,
And your youths shall see visions.
Transliteration: vehayah acharey-khen eshefvokhe et-ruchiy al-khׇl-vashar veniveu veneykhem uvenvoteykhem zikeneykhem chalomvot yachalomun vachureykhem chezeyonvot yireu

Hebrew: וְגַ֥ם עַל־הָעֲבָדִ֖ים וְעַל־הַשְּׁפָח֑וֹת בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֔מָּה אֶשְׁפּ֖וֹךְ אֶת־רוּחִֽי׃
Translated:
I will even pour out My spirit
Upon male and female slaves in those days.
Transliteration: vegam al-haavadiym veal-hashefachvot vayamiym hahemah eshefvokhe et-ruchiy

Hebrew: וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ מֽוֹפְתִ֔ים בַּשָּׁמַ֖יִם וּבָאָ֑רֶץ דָּ֣ם וָאֵ֔שׁ וְתִֽימְר֖וֹת עָשָֽׁן׃
Translated:
Before the great and terrible day of GOD comes,
I will set portents in the sky and on earth:
Blood and fire and pillars of smoke;
Transliteration: venatatiy mvofetiym vashamayiim uvaarets dam vaesh vetiymervot ashan

Hebrew: הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ יֵהָפֵ֣ךְ לְחֹ֔שֶׁךְ וְהַיָּרֵ֖חַ לְדָ֑ם לִפְנֵ֗י בּ֚וֹא י֣וֹם יְהֹוָ֔ה הַגָּד֖וֹל וְהַנּוֹרָֽא׃
Translated:
The sun shall turn into darkness
And the moon into blood.
Transliteration: hashemesh eihafekhe lechoshekhe vehayarecha ledam lifeney vvo yvom yehovah hagadvol vehanvora

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כֹּ֧ל אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָ֛א בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה יִמָּלֵ֑ט כִּ֠י בְּהַר־צִיּ֨וֹן וּבִירוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם תִּהְיֶ֣ה פְלֵיטָ֗ה כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה וּבַ֨שְּׂרִידִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה קֹרֵֽא׃
Translated: But everyone who invokes G<small>OD</small>’s name shall escape; for there shall be a remnant on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, as G<small>OD</small> promised. Anyone who invokes G<small>OD</small> will be among the survivors.
Transliteration: vehayah khol asher-yikera veshem yehovah yimalet khiy vehar-tsiyyvon uviyrushala͏im tiheyeh feleytah khaasher amar yehovah uvasheriydiym asher yehovah kore
